thread.title: Watch Cate Blanchett’s sultry lip-synch performance at a drag show
thread.title_full: Watch Cate Blanchett’s sultry lip-synch performance at a drag show

author: Madeline Raynor
title: Watch Cate Blanchett’s sultry lip-synch performance at a drag show
text:
Jared Siskin/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images 
Is there anything Cate Blanchett can’t do? 
On Monday night, the actress lip-synched to Lesley Gore’s “You Don’t Own Me” at historic LGBT venue The Stonewall Inn. At the Inn’s Broadway Review event — which benefitted the Newtown Action Alliance , an organization dedicated to ending gun violence — Blanchett took the stage wearing a gold bra-and-undies combo beneath a black blazer for the sultry, commanding performance. Luckily, it was captured on video. 
Blanchett headlined the event along with hair-and-makeup artist Jason Hayes, and the night featured additional performances by drag queens Aurora Sexton, Candice Cox, Vanice Vega, Zola Powell, and Brenda Dharling. The Stonewall Inn released a video of Margeaux Powell’s performance, during which she was joined on stage by Blanchett, who sported a pink pussy hat. 
See pictures and videos from the night below: A post shared by David (@weaselingaround) on Feb 20, 2017 at 9:47pm PST 
A post shared by Ian Carlos Crawford (@ianxcarlos) on Feb 21, 2017 at 9:15am PST A post shared by Ian Carlos Crawford (@ianxcarlos) on Feb 20, 2017 at 8:05pm PST A post shared by Stonewall (@thestonewallinn) on Feb 20, 2017 at 6:20pm PST Show Full Article
